meanings.definition: Excessive pride in oneself or one's achievements.
meanings.sent1: His smugness after winning the game was evident to everyone.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't hide her smugness when she received the award.
meanings.sent3: The cat's smugness after catching the mouse was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her smugness was like a heavy cloak, weighing her down with arrogance.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's smugness about knowing all the answers annoyed the students.

meanings.definition: A feeling of self-satisfaction or superiority.
meanings.sent1: The smugness in his smile showed he thought he was better than everyone else.
meanings.sent2: There was a hint of smugness in her voice when she talked about her promotion.
meanings.sent3: His smugness about always being right made him a bit unbearable.
meanings.sent4: The smugness of the wealthy elite was like a barrier between them and the rest of society.
meanings.sent5: The politician's smugness about his popularity was shattered after the scandal.
